availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph R. Lear (Brown County, IL, farmer )

body.p: Brown County, Illinois, farmer. Pennsylvania native. Son of John Lear and Mariah Lear. Married to Casander Lear. Father of Celesta Lear and James J. Lear. Student in Bedford County, Pennsylvania, in 1850. Farmer in Cooperstown, Illinois, in 1860. Employed William Irvin as a farmer in Cooperstown in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Bedford County, Broad Top, p. 267A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Brown County, Cooperstown, p. 737.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Brown County, Cooperstown, p. 21B.
"Joseph Richardson Lear (1835-1911)," Find A Grave, Memorial #11293558, accessed August 19, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/11293558.
